snippet: President Juan Manuel Santos called it a “deliberate attack” by the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia and said the military could resume bombing guerrilla encampments.
abstract: At least 10 Colombian soldiers are killed by Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia in what government calls deliberate attack, endangering cease-fire and fragile peace process; Pres Juan Manuel Santos orders FARC to track down and punish guerrillas responsible but does not suspend peace talks.
lead_paragraph: President Juan Manuel Santos called it a “deliberate attack” by the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia and said the military could resume bombing guerrilla encampments.

headline.main: Killing of 10 Soldiers Deals a Setback to Colombian Peace Talks with FARC Rebels
headline.print_headline: Killing of 10 Soldiers Deals a Setback to Colombian Peace Talks
